de.samdev.absgdx.framework.menu

Class GUITextureProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.samdev.absgdx.framework.menu.GUITextureProvider

  • public class GUITextureProvider
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that provides Textures for GUI objects Textures are identified by target class + identifier

        public void set(java.lang.Class<?> target,
       java.lang.String identifier,
       com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion texture)
        Add a Texture to the provider, textures are identified by a class and an identifier
        Parameters:
        target - the identifier class
        identifier - the identifier string
        texture - the texture to use

      • set

        public void set(java.lang.Class<?> target,
       java.lang.String identifier,
       java.lang.Object appendix,
       com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion texture)
        Add a Texture to the provider, textures are identified by a class and an identifier
        Parameters:
        target - the identifier class
        identifier - the identifier string
        appendix - an optional appendix to the identifier
        texture - the texture to use

      • get

        public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion get(java.lang.Class<?> target,
                                              java.lang.String identifier)
        Get a Texture from the provider, textures are identified by a class and an identifier Will return NULL if texture not found
        Parameters:
        target - the identifier class
        identifier - the identifier string
        Returns:
        the texture identified by {target + ':' + identifier}

      • get

        public com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion get(java.lang.Class<?> target,
                                              java.lang.String identifier,
                                              java.lang.Object appendix)
        Get a Texture from the provider, textures are identified by a class and an identifier Will return NULL if texture not found
        Parameters:
        target - the identifier class
        identifier - the identifier string
        appendix - an optional appendix to the identifier
        Returns:
        the texture identified by {target + ':' + identifier + '#' + appendix}

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if textures are found

      • setGeneric9SideTexture

        public void setGeneric9SideTexture(java.lang.Class<?> tclass,
                          com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion tex_TL,
                          com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion tex_TT,
                          com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion tex_TR,
                          com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion tex_RR,
                          com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion tex_BR,
                          com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion tex_BB,
                          com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion tex_BL,
                          com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion tex_LL,
                          com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion tex_CC,
                          java.lang.Object appendix)
        Set the textures for a specific class
        Parameters:
        tclass - the class to test
        tex_TL - the top left corner texture
        tex_TT - the top edge texture (can be repeated)
        tex_TR - the top right corner texture
        tex_RR - the right edge texture (can be repeated)
        tex_BR - the bottom right corner texture
        tex_BB - the bottom edge texture (can be repeated)
        tex_BL - the bottom left corner texture
        tex_LL - the left edge texture (can be repeated)
        tex_CC - teh center texture (can be repeated in both axis)
        appendix - an optional appendix to the identifier

      • setGeneric9SideTexture

        public void setGeneric9SideTexture(java.lang.Class<?> tclass,
                          com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion[][] texture)
        Set the textures for a specific class
        Parameters:
        tclass - the class to test
        texture - the textures ordered in a 3x3 square ( TextureRegion[Y][X] )
